---
title: "Supplementary Figures and Tables: Posterior Predictive Checks"
date: "Updated: `r Sys.Date()`"
output: word_document
---

```{r, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE, results='asis', warning=FALSE,}
results_name<-"Results_2024-04-06"

fc1 <- "Figure S1. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval () for hatchery origin spawner count $s_{H}$ used in to estimate proportion of hatchery origin spawners."

fc2 <- "Figure S2. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for female spawner count $s_{F}$ used in to estimate proportion of female spawners."

fc3 <- "Figure S3. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for recaptures $m$ used in mark recapture estimates of spawner abundance."

fc4 <- "Figure S4. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for for marks $n1$ used in mark recapture estimates of spawner abundance."

fc5 <- "Figure S5. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for index redd counts $r_{I}$."

fc6 <- "Figure S6. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for GRTS redd counts $r$. Both x and y axes are log10 transformed and a constant of 1 was added to observations and predictions to aid visualization. Coloring depicts observations within and outside of the 95% PPI. A jitter was applied to x values."

fc7 <- "Figure S7. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for the trap and haul census wild adult coho salmon  count $T_{W}$."

fc8 <- "Figure S8. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for the trap and haul census hatchery adult coho salmon  count $T_{H}$."

fc9 <- "Figure S9. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for the catch record card point estimate of hatchery adult coho salmon catch $c$ used in to estimate exploitation rates occuring upstream of dams after the release of trap-and-haul adults."

fc10 <- "Figure S10. Regression of observed vs. 95% posterior predictive interval for GRTS redd counts $r$. Panels are years (rows) and subpopulations (columns) and data are individual reach-level redd counts."
```

```{r, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE, results='asis', warning=FALSE, fig.show='asis', fig.cap=fc1 }
knitr::include_graphics(here::here(file.path("results",results_name,"H_PPC.png")))
```
